View Travel Podcasts » Hostels in Australia, Oceania Show Map Hide Map Australia has a very organized hostel industry and includes independent hostels and members of marketing groups and chains including Nomads, YHA, and VIP. Most Australian hostels are self-catering in a friendly, relaxed atmosphere. View all cities in New South Wales » Top Cities in New South Wales Sydney Australia from Fr.13.20 87 Properties Byron Bay Australia from Fr.20.00 12 Properties Port Macquarie Australia from Fr.20.64 5 Properties Blue Mountains Australia from Fr.15.84 8 Properties Coffs Harbour Australia from Fr.20.80 4 Properties Newcastle Australia from Fr.24.01 3 Properties View all cities in Queensland » Top Cities in Queensland Cairns Australia from Fr.7.20 32 Properties Brisbane Australia from Fr.12.80 27 Properties Surfers Paradise Australia from Fr.17.60 8 Properties Airlie Beach Australia from Fr.19.20 9 Properties Noosa Australia from Fr.22.40 6 Properties Townsville Australia from Fr.2.66 8 Properties View all cities in Victoria » Top Cities in Victoria Melbourne Australia from Fr.14.40 48 Properties Apollo Bay Australia from Fr.22.40 3 Properties Warrnambool Australia from Fr.16.00 2 Properties Torquay Australia from Fr.29.05 1 Property Port Campbell Australia from Fr.24.94 1 Property Anglesea Australia from Fr.24.01 1 Property View all cities in Western Australia » Top Cities in Western Australia Perth Australia from Fr.10.40 29 Properties Broome Australia from Fr.13.90 4 Properties Fremantle Australia from Fr.17.60 7 Properties Bunbury Australia from Fr.24.20 3 Properties Coral Bay Australia from Fr.25.61 1 Property Margaret River Australia from Fr.20.00 2 Properties All States in Australia Australian Capital Territory New South Wales Northern Territory Queensland South Australia Tasmania Victoria Western Australia Hostels vary greatly from large city hostels in Sydney and Melbourne to beach-side properties in Queensland, mountain cabins in Tasmania and lodges in the Australian outback. Many hostels will include facilities such a swimming pool, pool table, BBQ area and bicycle, surf board and boogie board hire. Most have communal living areas, internet and laundry services and nearly all have 24 hour access. Many city hostels have internal recruitment and travel agencies. Hostels in Australia, Oceania

Show Map
Hide Map
Australia has a very organized hostel industry and includes independent hostels and members of marketing groups and chains including Nomads, YHA, and VIP. Most Australian hostels are self-catering in a friendly, relaxed atmosphere.

Hostels vary greatly from large city hostels in Sydney and Melbourne to beach-side properties in Queensland, mountain cabins in Tasmania and lodges in the Australian outback.
Many hostels will include facilities such a swimming pool, pool table, BBQ area and bicycle, surf board and boogie board hire. Most have communal living areas, internet and laundry services and nearly all have 24 hour access. Many city hostels have internal recruitment and travel agencies.
